properties.name: Aerial Lift Bridge
properties.desc: Duluth's iconic Lift Bridge is an amazing piece of engineering history.  Click to learn more about the history and beauty of the Aerial Lift Bridge (http://www.GoDuluthMN.com/aerial-lift-bridge.html).

properties.name: Canal Park
properties.desc: Basically, this entire piece of land up until the Aerial Lift Bridge is known as the Canal Park area.  This is the epicenter of Duluth.  You must visit this area when you're in Duluth.  Click to learn more about Canal Park (http://www.goduluthmn.com/cana

properties.name: Duluth Depot
properties.desc: Now the epicenter of culture in Duluth, it houses many organizations and museums as the St. Louis County Heritage and Arts Center.  The Duluth Union Depot was built in the early 1890s and remains an architectural marvel.  Click to learn more about the hi

properties.name: Duluth Lakewalk
properties.desc: This is the western end of the Lakewalk.  It travels more than 4.5 miles along the lake and there are many great stops along the way.  It's great for a leisurely walk or some exercise.  Click to learn more about the Lakewalk (http://www.goduluthmn.com/du

properties.name: Duluth Lakewalk
properties.desc: This is the eastern end of the over 4.5 mile long Lakewalk.  This is also the beginning of the Lakewalk Extension which travels over 2 more miles east along the lakefront and through some eastern neighborhoods of Duluth.  Click to learn more about the La

properties.name: THE EDGE- Edgewater Waterpark
properties.desc: Some great family fun is sure to be had at this huge indoor waterpark.  For people who can't get enough of the park, there's a large hotel that surrounds the waterpark.  Click to learn more about the rides and other fun stuff to do at Edgewater Waterpark

properties.name: Enger Park and Tower
properties.desc: The beautiful Enger Park has many unique features within.  Enger Tower is just one of them and climbing to the top provides an amazing panoramic view of Duluth.  Click here to find out more about Enger Park and Tower (http://www.GoDuluthMN.com/enger-park

properties.name: Fond-Du-Luth Casino
properties.desc: If you are looking for a little adult entertainment, consider this downtown Duluth casino.  There are over 700 slot machines and several blackjack tables.  Click to get more information about Fond-Du-Luth Casino (http://www.GoDuluthMN.com/fond-du-luth-ca

properties.name: Glensheen Mansion
properties.desc: The early 20th century home of the Congdon's is now a tourist destination visited by thousands every year.  You will get an idea of how "The Haves" lived during this period of time.  It's a truly magnificent and beautiful estate.  Click to learn more abo

properties.name: Grandma's Restaurant
properties.desc: Officially named Grandma's Saloon & Grill, this is the most famous restaurant in all of Duluth.  The food is good and a local history lesson comes free with the meal.  Click to see what I mean about Grandma's Restaurant (http://www.goduluthmn.com/grandma

properties.name: Great Lakes Aquarium
properties.desc: There's a lot to learn at this amazing Duluth Aquarium. The focus is on local species, however, there are plenty exotic fish and animals as well. Click to find out more about the Great Lakes Aquarium (http://www.goduluthmn.com/great-lakes-aquarium.html).

properties.name: Hawk Ridge Bird Observatory
properties.desc: During the autumn months, this is one of best places on Earth to watch migratory birds. Many different species of birds of prey like hawks, falcons, eagles and even owls fly by this amazing place. Click to learn more about the amazing Hawk Ridge Bird Obs

properties.name: Jay Cooke State Park
properties.desc: If you want to explore one of the most beautiful State Parks in Minnesota, this is a great option.  It's very close to Duluth and worth the short drive.  Whether you drive through the park or explore on foot, it'll surely be a blast!  Click to learn more

properties.name: Lake Superior Marine Museum & Maritime Visitor Center
properties.desc: To learn about the history of the Great Lakes freighters and life on Lake Superior, a visit to the Lake Superior Marine Museum and Maritime Visitor Center (http://www.GoDuluthMN.com/duluth-maritime-museum.html) is in order.

properties.name: Lake Superior Zoo
properties.desc: The natural beauty of this area is highlighted by the way this Duluth zoo was built and has been maintained.  This is a great place to visit with the whole family.  Click to learn more about the history, features and famous residents of the Lake Superior

properties.name: Leif Erikson Park and The Rose Garden
properties.desc: There is quite a lot to do at this great park.  You will learn a bit about the Vikings and Duluth's history.  Amazingly, The Rose Garden is entirely on top of Interstate 35!  It's a rare English Rose Garden and is breathtaking.  Click to learn more about

properties.name: Park Point
properties.desc: This is the beginning of the world's longest freshwater sandbar!  As such, along the entire lakeside, Seven Mile Beach is a great place to walk and watch the ships come in to port.  Click to learn more about Park Point (http://www.goduluthmn.com/park-poi

properties.name: Skyline Parkway
properties.desc: This is the western end of Skyline Parkway.  It travels all the way to Lester Park in the eastern part of the city.  Traveling along "The Boulevard" is a great way to see the city.  Click to learn more about Skyline Parkway (http://www.goduluthmn.com/sky

properties.name: Skyline Parkway
properties.desc: This is the eastern end of Skyline Parkway.  It's an amazing scenic road that meanders through the city of Duluth.  Most of the journey is on the hillside and affords some magnificent views.  Click to learn more about the views and parks along Skyline Pa

properties.name: Spirit Mountain
properties.desc: This is a great ski facility during the winter.  There's summer fun to be had here as well.  There are campgrounds and loads of hiking trails.  Click to learn more about all the fun at Spirit Mountain (http://www.goduluthmn.com/spirit-mountain.html).

properties.name: SS William A Irvin
properties.desc: Tour one of the grandest ship in Great Lakes history. This ship was the flagship of the US Steel fleet for decades. There's a lot to learn while aboard. Click to learn more about the history and what you'll see when you tour the SS William A. Irvin (http

properties.name: Vista Fleet Duluth Cruises
properties.desc: This is the location of the dock of the Vista Fleet Duluth Harbor Cruises.  There are sightseeing, dinner and some specialty cruises aboard the two Vista boats, the Queen and the Star.  Click to learn more about Vista Fleet Duluth Cruises (http://www.god
